utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How's your vacation to Europe?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I think it's nice. I went to Denmark, Sweden and Norway.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh, so you've been to all of the Scandinavian countries?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah, Scandinavian countries.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So what did you like in Denmark?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You know, Denmark is quite special. It's like the kingdom of bicycles. Where like people mostly riding bicycles on their roads.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh yeah, I remember that I have been once to Copenhagen.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh, I've been there too.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah, I saw a lot of canals and also a lot of boats. I think there are a lot of nice restaurants.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh, you know what? Bicycles have the highest priority during the traffic.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh, yeah, I remember, I remember, I remember that. They also have special dedicated lanes for bicycles.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't think we could get this done tonight.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh, I think we don't need to worry about it. We can do it tomorrow..

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But I think our boss will not leave us too much time, so we have to finish it tonight. And I'm really, really tired now.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What about we go outside and have a dinner, and then we go back and continue to do this?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I think it is okay to have a dinner, but our time is a little bit... limited so we need to eat it very quickly and do you have some quick food to let me enjoy it?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know there is a new open I think maybe this made some noodle we can eat that that's quickly

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: okay I think it is a good idea

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey, do you know that there's recently been a conflict between our brother's university and our university?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't. What's the matter?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Basically, it's about the ranking issue. So, you know, we share the same ranking, and that's the time when the QS ranking is released.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So they refused to share the ranking with us?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah, that's basically the truth. Because they think that... Our university is actually attached to theirs and we do not deserve to have the same rank as they do.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So what do you think of this?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well, as a matter of fact, I believe that we should share the same rank because the students between these two universities do have similar capability.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm new here. Can you take me to the best restaurant in town?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: This depends on what cuisine you like, though. What type of food do you usually prefer?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Um, I like Korean food or Chinese food, but I'm open to try new things.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Is there anything that you can't eat or are allergic to?.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well, I can't have spicy food, I can't have sour food, and I also can't have lactose, so...

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh, that's alright. There's this Korean hot dog place in Queens Bay Mall that I think is really delicious. Some of their sauces are spicy, but you can choose to get the non-spicy option since since that's probably what you would prefer.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That sounds great! Thank you!

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I always take a shower in the evening. I don't understand why there are some people taking a shower in the morning.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But taking a shower in the morning helps you to wake up, make you feel fresh to start the day, and you feel clean.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But if you take a shower in the morning, you have to take a shower in the evening too, because there's no way you're going to sleep on your bed with the day's dirt and grime all over you. You're going to have to change your bedsheets soon.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah, you can take a shower twice. You can take a short morning shower, then you'll take another shower at night.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah, but that's so time-consuming. That takes up so much time.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How long do you take to shower?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I feel like people usually shower for like 30 to 40 minutes, right? So in total, that would be like 1 hour and 20 minutes. That's so time-consuming.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What do you want to have for dinner tonight?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I want to have fish and chips.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh, fish and chips. I like it too.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah, they're my favorite.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you like to have a dine-in or ask for delivery?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah, I want to ask for delivery because I want to stay at home and watch TV.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh, it feels cool. We can just eat fish and chips with AC.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah. Anything you want?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I want a large Coke, maybe.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I also want to have some hamburgers. How about you?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It sounds great. How about the beef one?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah. I want to have a beef burger.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So, totally, we got a fish and chips, a hamburger, and a large coke.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Okay, let's wait and enjoy.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah, I like it.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey, do you have an umbrella? There's a rain outside. I don't have an umbrella right now.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh, sorry. I don't have an umbrella with me either. I was about to ask you for the umbrella.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh, so what will we do now? The rain is very fast outside.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah, it's raining so heavily now. I checked the news. It's like a red alert.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So, we should go to a shop to buy umbrella. Do you have enough money to buy it?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah, I think i have money for the shop. But when we go to the shop, we also need another umbrella

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Umbrella so what what we can do? We should plan it uh think about it, what we can do. Because we have to go home. We don't have any other option. Maybe we can call a taxi.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah, maybe we can just wait here for the rain to stop.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hey bro, did you just ult the air again?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hey, it looked like the enemy was there, okay?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah, and I look like I have six-pack abs. Doesn't make it true.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Woof, personal attack now?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That wasn't personal. That was observational.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You know what? I'm logging off after this. My pride needs sleep.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Your pride's been asleep since we hit bronze.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Okay, rude but fair.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And also... Did you just door dash cookies mid-match?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Listen, my fight better... No, I fight better when I'm emotionally supported by sugar.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You fight better when you don't fight at all.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Then I was basically a pacifist hero.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You're a snack food with a liability.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And yet, you're keeping killing with me.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Because it's either this or talking to my plants.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Um, plants will probably die less than me.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Shut up and pick your character.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So what kind of activities do you and your brother usually do?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: To be fair, we have very different interests. So he prefers playing games and stuff. And I like reading manhua and stuff. And he does not have the attention span to read manhua. And he doesn't really have the attention span for games as well. So he will have YouTube open on one slide and then his games open on another slide. But I still try to play with him sometimes. so we could bond over it. And because, you know, it's kind of fun.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ah, well, my sister also doesn't have the attention span to read anything. Like, I have a stack of books, and i'd be like, hey, you want to read any of my books? And she's gonna say no. She's always gonna say no. She stole two of my books recently, but she didn't steal them to read them. She stole them because apparently it fits her room's aesthetic.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: ah...

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How's university life?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Um, it's been fine. I mean, we still have assignments and we still have quizzes, but I think overall it's not so bad.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Like, compared to term one and term two, it's probably a lot better, right?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's a lot better. I mean, I don't feel like I'm constantly drowning in work anymore.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Me too. I feel like summer's been really relaxing, especially since, like, I only take one course now, and my professor's really nice, and he doesn't give too much work as well, so I'm basically done with everything now. I just need to do the finals.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh, my professor's really chill, too.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Doesn't he give you a lot of work?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But he's a chill guy. He makes jokes in class, so I guess that's okay. Cancels it out.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh, I mean, I guess so. I guess the professor is also really important in these type of courses.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Look, I'm sorry I snapped at you earlier. I was just stressed.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I get it. But yelling about dirty dishes at midnight wasn't exactly fair.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I know, I know. I overreacted. It's just, work's been insane lately.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You could've just said that. I could've understood, I think.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm not great at that, am I?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Not really. I stuck at remembering the dishes, so I guess we were even.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Deal. Truce?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Truce. And hey, next time, just shoot me a text instead of storming like a... Godzilla.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No promises, but I'll try.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How have you been feeling lately?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I’ve been feeling a little light-headed lately.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Has your blood pressure been high before?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: If I have high blood pressure, it is news to me.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Usually people with high blood pressure have no symptoms, so we call it the silent killer.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What do you use to check for high blood pressure?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Umm….I am going to put a cuff on you to get a reading.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What does the reading tell you?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I get an idea of the pressure in your arteries when your heart is pumping blood versus at rest.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I hope that the test results show me to be really healthy.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi, what brings you to my office today?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I’ve been getting really short of breath, and my coach wanted to have a doctor check me out.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have you had the flu lately?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No, I have been pretty healthy. I just have trouble taking a really deep breath.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have you ever been tested for allergies?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Umm…. Peaches make me break out, but I don’t have any other allergies.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Does this happen all the time or maybe a little more in the cold weather?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I’ve noticed that it is worse when I am under stress, like during finals week.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I feel that you should see a pulmonary specialist to check for asthma.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I appreciate the referral, doctor.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Can I help you, Madam?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes, I'd like to exchange some US dollars into RIB.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How much would you like to exchange?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What's the exchange rate for RIB?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's hundred US dollars for eight hundred two RIB today.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'd like to exchange three thousand.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Fill out this exchange memo, please.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes. Here you are.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Wait a second, please... These are twenty four thousand sixty RIBs and the receipt, please check them.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: All right, thank you so much, good-bye.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good-bye.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No, I mean, maybe in the little--going around thingy thing where bopper stole it from there.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Okay. All I know is that I am supposed to have my language here right now. Right now. And it's not there. And you're supposed to help me because you work at the airport. So give me my luggage or tell me where the hell it is.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Okay. What can we do is we can get your name and information and if it shows up we can send it to you so-- Wherever you stay

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What do you mean, if it shows up? No, I need it now. I have my keys, I have my wallet, I have my money. I have thousands and thousands of dollars worth of stuff in there.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Not to mention I have my work in there.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well, I'll have you fill out some paperwork and see if you can get started on something.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And what if- what if it is lost? Well, what are you guys going to do for me?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You know, we'll file a complaint and we could possibly, you know, replace some of the things. I think-

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: and when you sign your ticket we could replace about fifteen percent of what's in the bag.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Fifteen percent?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes. I mean, it's not as rough on me as it is on him but

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: God, it's you know, we've spent so much time with them it's just really surreal, really weird that we're not going to be able to see her anymore and go

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: out to- out to dinner you know and do the troops to California, I mean.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Totally.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's just that- I don't know, it's sort it's sort- of a weird thing you know

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: not being able to see anyone again, who knows where they really went, you know. I mean, I guess we can just hope that wherever they are now if it's anywhere that it's better I mean.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes. Well, at least you have a lot of good memories.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: She was [garbage]

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's college- oh my God it's college, [GARBAGE] so it's like crazy.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know. It's so cool.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh man. So, I don't know you know, we'll see - we'll see how it goes and, yeah, I'm looking forward to it

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Fair for you, Wow, oh my Gosh.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I mean you got to - you got to show me the ropes 'cause I've never been there before so I mean you know your way around already and- [LAUGHTER]

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I will do the best I can.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well, there are all kinds of awesome secrets so you'll really enjoy it. It's really great. I'm so glad.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh, alright.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm-I'm looking forward to that. [BREATHING] man, So yeah, I think I'm going to come out a little early so I mean I'll give you a call and we'll definitely-

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yay

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well I got an idea, but what's your story?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm going to ask her to marry me.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well that's only your business, Chris.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You know it's not just my business.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well what do you want me to do?  You're old enough to know your own mind.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: So all right then, I'll just go ahead with it?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well you want to make sure that your father is not going to --

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Then it's not just my business.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm just saying.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You know sometimes you infuriate me.  you know that?  Isn't it your business if I tell father and he throws a fit about it?  God, you have such a talent for ignoring things.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And I'm like freaking out. I'm like what the hell's going on, you know. I don't know what's going on. And so he's like standing there and then all of a sudden they give him a microphone-

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: and he just starts doing like this little spiel about me and like

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: he asked me to marry him, like- onstage. I was like, I couldn't believe--and I had to walk up there and I was, like I think I tripped or something.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Are you kidding me?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Wha- What'd you say? You said yes, right? [LAUGHTER]

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah, I said yes, but I, yeah, I mean,

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't know- it just like took me, took me by surprise.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He scored points.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Did you get a standing ovation?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Did you go to the movie yesterday?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes, I did.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What did you think of it?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't think much of the film.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I think it is the worst one I have ever seen.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh, I'm not sure I agree with you. It was not a good one, but it was not the worst one. Actually, it wasn't too bad.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I can't think the same.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What's more, some scenes were good, much fit for the children.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I couldn't agree with you.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's only going to be a year.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's the first year of your child's life.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: There's really -- there's nothing I can do.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You're just fine with this?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: There's nothing I --

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You're just going to pick up and leave me and our baby and miss a year of our lives?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's -- look, it's only a year.  It'll go by quickly.  Okay.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: When you get back, think of all of the things that you're going to have missed.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I know, but I'll be back then.  And - and- and we'll have -- we have the rest of our lives.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don't go.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: If you really cared so much, you'd find a way out.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: There's nothing I can do.  I-- I

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Fine, fine.  We have to be together.  If you can't stay here, then I'll go with you.  I don't care where you go.  We'll go, too.  I'm not staying behind.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: They won't let you come along.  It's not going to happen.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's a free world.  I can go where I want.  Wherever you are, that's where we're going to go.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Are you kidding? Please don't be difficult about this.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Difficult.  You're leaving for a year. We have a newborn child and you're leaving.  I don't think I'm being difficult.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: [BREATHING]

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm finding a way to make it work.  And I will go wherever you go.  Whatever I have to do, I will make this work.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Look, I--

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Nine one one emergency. What is the problem?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I would like to report a break-in.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: When was this break-in?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I believe it happened last night.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Where was the break-in?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It happened at my house.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Was anything stolen?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I haven't checked yet.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why do you think there was a break-in?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My front window was broken.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We'll send a squad car shortly.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'd appreciate that.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good morning. Wilson Association.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: This is Mr. Brown speaking. I'd like to speak to Mr. Thomas, please.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm sorry, but Mr. Thomas left the office a few minutes ago.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's bad! I've been trying to call him for the last ten minutes, but your line has been busy. Will he be back soon?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm afraid not. He's gone for the rest of the day.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Is there anywhere I can reach him?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't believe so. He's going out of town on business. May I take a message?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Umm I have a business appointment with him for tomorrow morning at ten o'clock, but I'm afraid I can't make it.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Would you care to make another appointment?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Unfortunately, I'm leaving town rather unexpectedly, and I may be gone for several days.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I see. I can tell Mr. Thomas that you phoned.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Bye-bye.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Will you write me letters, paper ones?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah, of course. I don't know if we'll have computers or anything like that you know, so probably my only option then.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah, I'll write you every day 'cause you're the only thing that's going to be on my mind.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Our baby needs a dad; you can't leave. Okay, you can't disappear.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Our baby has a dad, alright. Daddy is going to be back soon.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I want you to, you know, take lots of video; pictures and I can see you when I get back or while I'm there. I'm going to miss you.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'll miss you too.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Did you hear anything about the robbery?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I watched it happen.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Really?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes. I was right there.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What did you see?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: This guy tried to rob the bank.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I can't believe it.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I was really scared when he pulled the gun out.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What happened next?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: He tried to leave with the money.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Did he get caught?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: They caught him before he could walk through the front door.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I have applied for a transfer.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really? Umm do you mean that you are leaving?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes. I think it's time to move on. I’ve already been here too long.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Where do you want to go?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well, I want to be transferred to the Shanghai office.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I will miss you. But anyway I wish you every success at your new post.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks. It's been a pleasure working with you.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: She really cared about you, you know.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes, I mean she cared about all of us. She was great

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: so loving everybody you know.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And she was

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Gosh, I just hate I just hate to see her go.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We were all going take a trip to Europe you know.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Even if you still do she'll- she'll be there.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes.  [BREATHING] God.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Are you going to be okay?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: This form is a Z.X.four.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You can't--  This is not the line for Z.X.four.  If you're going to fill out the Z.X.four, you need to have a different form of ID.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What?  I'm getting an ID.  This is why I'm here.  My wallet was stolen.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No. I need another set of ID to prove this is actually you.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How am I supposed to get an ID without an ID?  How does a person get an ID in the first place?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't know.  But I need an ID to pass this form along.  I can't just send it along without an ID.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm here to get an ID.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No.  I need another ID, a separate one.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Like what?  Like a birth certificate?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: A birth certificate, a passport...a student ID; didn't you go to school?  Anything?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's- It's dangerous anywhere, honey. I mean this is -this- I'm just going to go and we'll get it over with,

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'll come back we'll have, you know, some good benefits from being in the service and then we'll live - we'll live a happy life, then the rest of us, like the three of us.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I hope so.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: A little family.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I hope so.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You gotta

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's going to be really rough.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You gotta take care of our baby for me, alright?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'll send you lots of pictures.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What do you want me to do? What do you want?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I want you to-- I want you to act like he is coming back, both of you.  Don't think I haven't noticed you since Chris invited her here.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I won't stand for any nonsense.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Kate.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Because if he's not coming back, I'll kill myself.  Oh laugh, laugh all you like but why does this happen the very night he comes back.  She goes to sleep in his room and his memorial breaks in pieces.  Look at it, Joe, look.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: [BREATHING]

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Calm yourself.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Just believe with me, Joe. Only last week a man came back in Detroit missing longer than Larry.  Believe with me. You, above all, have got to believe. Just believe.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Okay. Calm yourself.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I know. All right, all right. All right. Okay.  Calm yourself. What does that mean, me above all?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: yes, this is [LAUGHTER], it says U.S.C., like registrar, I mean like, I got-I got some like little letters before you know, it's like oh rejection

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: [LAUGHTER] It's gotta be it, like-

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh my Gosh, that's so cool.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: but big packet, big packet is nice

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: big packet is gotta be the real thing. yeah

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So it's like, yes, rip it open and there it is big - oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh my Gosh. I thought there was like, maybe going to be some, like I don't know if you are going to get in or not, so I'm really glad that you did.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's so cool.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah. I know, I know.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: it was you know I wasn't too sure I mean you know it was kind of last minute for like the application

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Have you tried, uh, Craig's List?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Uh, what?  Craig's List?  Oh the internet thing?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't know.  Isn't that-- that's all like escort services and things like that.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No.  There's regular jobs on there.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't know.  I mean I've been looking for so long that I just figured that--  I mean, I think things like Monster are a lot more reliable than just some random free board.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Uh huh.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm just saying I have a friend that got a good job on it so I was just recommending it.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What kind of a job?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: He's like a manager for a theatre.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: This is so great, you know, because I gone fit on downtown so I'm going to be like right here.  I think I'm going to be living at City Lights downtown.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: This is so exciting.  This is like a new chapter in our lives.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah, it really is.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We're doing what we want to do, then four years later we're going to be working professionals, making money, sipping martinis every day.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: God hopefully.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Man I'm just so happy for you.  I just--

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well, I'm happy for you but I'm happy for me cause that means you're going to stay.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And tonight my parents want to take me out to sushi and they said I could bring you.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh great. I would love to go.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hello, Tom!

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Hello, Skylar!

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How are you doing?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Not bad. What about you?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm just a little tired.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I have a lot of work to do in the company recently.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How is your family?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Pretty fine, thanks.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Where are you going now?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I am going to buy a new air conditioner for my parents. Oh, it’s two o’clock. I must go now.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: OK, see you next time.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: See you.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't like- I don't like sending things in the mail.  I don't want my information out there.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No.  You can- or you can just bring it in person.  But they need, generally, something to see, you know, what kind of what that you've done, what kind of--

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm there in front of them.  I'm telling them what I'm good at.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah.  But the piece of paper helps, too.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why?  It's a piece of paper.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No.  But it has an outline, you know.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I just don't want this paper trail, you know.  I just don't want things following me around, like-.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know.  Okay.  Well, um. Maybe--

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's just-- You know, I've had this problem before.  You're not the first person to tell me that I need a resume but...

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You don’t look like enjoying this workout.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I’m not crazy about it at all.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You don’t like this sort of exercise?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I’m not interested in it. Are you keen on it?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes, that’s funny. I thought you liked it.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I hate it.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Never mind. It’ll be over in ten minutes.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It’s the worst thing I’ve ever tried.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What happened to you?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I think I caught a cold.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you have any symptoms?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Runny nose and coughing.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Do you have a fever?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Umm I have just taken the temperature, I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's not serious.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Are you sure?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What should I do?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You should drink more hot water, and do some exercise.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Good God.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Is it them?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I wonder.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Freda is the only one who knows we are here.  She wouldn't ring up.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It must be them then.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It had to happen sooner or later.  What are we going to do?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: [BREATHING]

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We are okay, aren't we darling?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Now and always, sweet.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't care then.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: [LAUGHTER]

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't really have any imagination, that's all I know how to say.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: [LAUGHTER]

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Am I embarrassing you? Are you - See, I didn't want to do it here with this yard, on this porch.  I wanted it to be somewhere new, some place fresh for both of us.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No. No

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You feel uncomfortable here, you feel that it's wrong here somehow.  I just...I don't...I didn't want...I didn't want to take you away from anything.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Chris, I've been ready a long, long, time.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: And he's gone forever?  Are you sure?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I almost got married two years ago.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Why didn't you?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I can't imagine what his- what his parents are going through.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course not.  You have no idea what it's like to lose a kid.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah, I'm just going to miss him.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course. If there's anything I can do, you just let me know.  Okay?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Of course.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Is there a funeral planned? or-

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah, they're going to do some sort of memorial service or something.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Cool, Well, If you want me to go with you, I will.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Ryan, what's wrong?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I just got some bad news.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My friend, Shotty, passed away.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh, I'm so sorry

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The end, he's been sick for awhile.  He had cancer.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh, my gosh.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah.  It's just, I never thought it would actually happen, you know? I mean- He's such a fighter and he's always so positive about everything.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You know, he was gonna, and we -- all the way up to the end we were just talking about how- you know all the stuff we were gonna do and, you know.  When he finally kicked this stupid cancer, you know, and we were gonna --

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What's your name?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My name is Wang Lin. My English name is Linda.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: A nice name, isn't it?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah, like it very much. My name has become a part of me.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Where do you live?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I live in the Haitian District.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh, It's really far from here. May I ask how old you are?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes, I’m thirty eight years old.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You look very young.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Where is your birthplace?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My birthplace is Yentai.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Alright, so you're not going to believe this.  But I went home today. I looked through the mail.  And I got an acceptance letter from U.S.C..

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What, no way.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm going to U.S.C.. Yeah.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah, yeah.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I didn't even

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: know you applied to U.S.C..

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I did.  I did. I've -- yeah, I applied to U.S.C..  I mean, it's really expensive but

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: it's a really good school.  So

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But, isn't there anything you can do.  Can't you make an exception this one time?  My picture is on both of those identifications.  It's not like you don't know that it's me.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I can't.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And I can give you my social--

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I make an exception for you and I have to make an exception for everyone.  I mean, I-I've seen this before and I know it's frustrating, but there's nothing I can do. You just have to-

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well, I can give you my Social Security Number.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No, it's--

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And I can tell you where I was born and what time and by who and what day.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Okay.  But how do I--that's- that's not proof to me.  How do I know that, you know, that it's really you.  I need--

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I can't go--I have to go back to work.  I don't have time to go back to my house and get all of that stuff and then get back in line and wait for another forty five minutes.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well, the weekends are not as busy.  Maybe you can uh, come and try to get here early--

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah, hi.  Um, look, I -- all I'm trying to do right now is renew my license plate.  That's all.  I just need to get one of those little stickers.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Okay.  What's the problem?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And I've- I've- some lady -- I got in line.  I waited for about two hours um, and, I gave her this form

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: that she gave to me earlier. And she said oh, I gave you the wrong one by accident.  So I was hoping I could just fill out a new one, give it to you and sort of skip this whole line business.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Okay, um.  Do you have your photo ID with you?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes, I do.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Okay.  This is the wrong form.  I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: This is -- okay, then just can I have the form that I need.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I don't have the form.  You're going to have to go get in that line over there and they will give you the right form.  And after you fill it out, you can bring it back to me.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I know. but you're not  I mean you're not going to forget him.  The pain will go away eventually and--or it will subside--

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You start to lose like that image after a while.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That will be, It'll be--it'll be better that way. I mean Time will tell.  Time heals, you know, and it's good.  It's okay.  I mean, it wasn't anybody's fault or anything like that so .

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's hard to lose someone that way, but he's he's better--he's better off now.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thanks.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi, sir.  How can I help you?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh, thank God.  Do you know how long I've been on the phone for half an hour trying to talk to a freaking human being.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: All I want to do is put my, pay for my freaking credit card, and there's something wrong in my bill, Like I swear, it says I didn't paid last month, but I know I paid last month.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Okay.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I put- I've been typing my number in millions of times, it won't listen to me, it's not working, and I can't get a single human being, and finally-

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: you are a real human being.  Thank you very, very much.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: [LAUGHTER] All right.  I'm sorry, sir that you've been having a hard time.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: This is ridiculous.  I- I seriously, I don't understand why you think these automated systems are supposed to like work for anybody.  They have never, ever work for me.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I kwon, it is ridiculous

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: yeah, I understand.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well, how does it look?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's a perfect fit.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Let me pay for it now.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Cash, credit card, or debit card?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Umm I think I'll use my credit card.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Your signature here, please, and we're finished.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Here's my John Hancock.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Bye-bye. Visit us again soon!

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You're just going to put it back on my account.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I mean, technically, that's policy.  But, like, I mean, I don't really care about -- nobody really cares about policy here.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So you're just going to take care of this for me?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sure.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh, my God, thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You're welcome.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I really appreciate this. I know it's not policy or whatever but, seriously

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No, no, no, it's cool.  It's cool.  It's cool.  So, um

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: make my life a lot easier.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What is it?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Sweetheart, I've got to tell you something.  I just got a call.  I'm going to Iraq.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know it's really crappy timing, but I don't have a choice.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What?  No, you can't!

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know. I have to go-

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You didn't- Did you tell them you have two young children at home?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You think they'd listen to me?  No.  Of course, I told them that.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And they didn't care?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What's your opinion about childless couples? Will you choose to have no kids?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: To be honest, I wouldn't.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why? Do you have to make a choice now?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Umm not really. But it has puzzled me for a long time.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What's the puzzle?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: My wife and I prefer to have no kids, but my mother-in-law is very traditional and wants grandkids.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh, I see. I think the older generation tend to think in a different way.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes. It seems she can never accept a childless marriage. We had a fight last night.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh, really? Maybe she is just eager to see her grandchildren.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But it's absolutely our own business to have a child or not.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Definitely.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I often overhear our neighbor fighting about how to raise their kid and I really don't want kids to spoil our happiness.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Don't worry. I think in most cases, children are the glue that keeps a family together.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I guess you're right. But I still prefer to have no child.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sure. You can fully enjoy your time together.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You didn't do what I told you to do.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's 'cause you always tell me to do the wrong thing.  And I thought this time it was -- I was gonna be right by going with the opposite thing. So it's your fault because

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: -because you were always wrong and-and-and this time you were right. And-and I didn't -- yeah, that's why.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's amazing logic that you managed to turn that around and make it my fault.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well, I mean, it makes sense, doesn't it, hmm?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I think maybe you can't get employed because you aren't willing to take responsibility for your own actions.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's not true.  I take responsibility for my own actions.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Really?  Whose fault is it you don't have a job?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yours.  I don't--

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: but, it's gonna be fine.  I'm gonna be fine.  You know I'm good at this.  I can do this.  That's why I trained all this time.  I'm good at this.  Okay?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But so many people have died.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I know.  I know.  I know.  But, you know what?  That doesn't mean it's gonna be me; does it?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I know.  I know.  I know I know. You're good You're good at what you do, but there's just so much chance involved.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No.  It doesn't.  And you can't think like that.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I mean, I-I know that you're a good soldier, but not everybody else is. and what if

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't want you to -- I know.  I know. You can't worry about me.  You've got to worry about the kids.  And you've got to take care of the kids for me.  Okay?  Take care of the kids for me; all right?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: And you know my mom's here.  She'll come over and she'll be with you all the time, whenever you need her.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's just so much.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'll miss you, baby.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Are we talking about the same thing, here?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm sorry, it's just fish to me.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Carla, can I ask you something?  Now, don't take this the wrong way, but are you on your period?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Don't ask me that.  I hate it when you ask me that, you always ask me that.  It's insulting.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well then, what's bugging you?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We just have different ideas of what this night is supposed to look like.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: There is nothing to it; we come down here, the fish arrive, they flop around, they do their fish thing.  We go ooh, ah, look at the fish and we go home.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: For God- Grow up, Augie.  The fish are not going to arrive.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why not?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Because they never do.  Have they...Have they ever?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't know astronaut?  I don't know something crazy like that.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well what'd you major in?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Biomedical Engineering.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You-You can't be working as a restaurant manager, I mean, come on.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't want to do engineering though.  It's so...I had the internship what, last summer,

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: and I was pulling my hair out and it was like, oh my God.  So I just had to finish the major so now they're like, why are you an engineering major, and why are you working, trying to work at a restaurant.  And it's like I don't know just give me the damn job.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Look I'm sorry-

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why all these questions?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You know if you need any help finding a place I can, I can talk to my work you know I work at that law firm downtown and I can ask if they're looking for anybody.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh yeah?  What kind of jobs they got?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's standard that you bring a couple of forms of ID, I'm sorry.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's standard? I mean I don't work at the D.M.V. how am I supposed to know that, like, I stand in line, I get my

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well, I'm sorry, sir, but we're not responsible.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I filled out the application right, didn't I?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes, you did, thank you very much, but we're not responsible if you've forgotten something, and we need to have two forms of ID.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Okay. What about - no -- how about you hold that and I'll - I'll go and I can come back-

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm sorry, but there is a lot of people waiting so you're just going to have to get in line again.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I've been waiting for three hours.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It just happens to people all the time, I'm sorry sir, but I can't make an exception for you.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: This is ridiculous. Come on

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well, um- we have a little problem with the system going on.  One of our satellites is down, and I-

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You know what?  I'm just going to- Patient?  I'm a busy man.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You're going to have to just be patient with us, sir, as we

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well, I know sir, and we all are busy.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But I'm going to definitely have to- uh--get your contact information

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: -have to, have to what?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: What?  It's my phone.  You can't even call me on it. I don't have another phone.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well, I don't-

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Okay, well, if you would like, um- we will be turning on the systems in probably about ten hours.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: This is the route I thought we could take on our hike on Saturday afternoon.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Umm how long is it altogether?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It’s about six or seven miles. That’s about ten kilometers.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That sounds OK. So, we start here at the car park and walk along the path to the waterfall.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Then we turn left and walk up this small hill. The view from the top of the hill is worth the climb. We can eat a snack there.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Then we will follow this path down the hill to the old church.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We can spend a few minutes looking around the church. Then, we turn right and walk along this path.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: This path leads to the cave. Can we look inside the cave?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes, we can, but it isn’t very interesting.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Then we turn south and come back to the car park along this path.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That’s right.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How long do you think it will take us to complete the walk?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I think it will take about four hours, including breaks.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That’s fine. Are there signposts along the way, in case we get lost?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yes, there are. They tell us which way to go and how far we have to walk.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh, yeah.  My mom's freaking out. Oh yeah, She's so happy. this is you know  It's her dream come true.  She always wanted her little boy -- she wants kids, you know.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: She wants grandkids. So we'll be working on that right away.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: right right.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Are you guys gonna have kids?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Of course, we're gonna have kids, like three at least.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Whoa, right away?.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: She wants like eight- She wants like eight kids and I'm like, no, no, no, no, no.  I am like what Let's do maybe three and we'll go with that.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Are you going to start right away?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well, we're going to take a little bit of time, you know, we need to get acclimated and you know start our lives, make money, you know be comfortable.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's almost time for me to go.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I can't believe that--now--are you sure this is absolutely necessary?  Like--

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: There's nothing I can do.  I mean, the government you know--

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What--what're we gonna do here?  I can't--I can't do this by myself.  I--

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: You're gonna have to.  I mean, you're a great father.  You can do it.  I know you can.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But, I'm--I'm nothing--I'm nothing without you here.  Maybe we can--we can get out of this somehow.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well, come on.  You've gotta think of something.  A year--a year away, it's gonna tear us apart.  I don't even--I don't even wanna think about it.  I mean, I don't even know if I'll be able to get in touch with you or--

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well, we can do the best we can and-and, with um, you know like wireless internet these days--I think that we could-- Talk every once in awhile.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's three years.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I understand, but you know what, you've been negative for three years.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Is that honestly what you think?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It's the way it seems to me.  You started complaining about not being able to find a job the first day you went out and didn't find a job.  And I'm not saying like and not trying to you know put you down or anything, it's just that-

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: That's really hard to hear.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: But it's true, babe.  You've got to be more positive about things.  Like- Have some faith in yourself.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I feel like I have faith and now faith is running thin because there is no money.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well, exactly.  Money is not everything.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Brian, I don't think you have a concept of what I mean by- by money.  I don't mean money like oh, I can't go get my hair and my nails done today, I mean like I can't eat.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You can.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Professor Wang, what is non-tariff barrier?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Non-tariff barrier is another mean to restrict imports.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Can you give an example?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: For example, some countries restrict imports by quantitative restriction.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Why?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: This is used to protect local industries or to achieve certain political objectives.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Oh, Are there other means?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Technical barriers are set for imported goods.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Umm…. This is designed to exclude them from domestic market, isn't it?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes, some countries may use some of the unnecessary health rules to exclude foreign food.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Everybody's going to come up. We're going to stay in all the pretty cabins up there and, um, everybody's going to have, you know, really flowery sort of naturey stuff.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: So pretty.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: That's great

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I hope- they're not like

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Very Midsummer Night's wedding.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Right.  Nice.  That's great.  I hope while we're up there nobody gets attacked by any, like, bears or wolves or anything.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Thanks. Thanks a lot.  You're really helping the Excitement here. I hope no one dies.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well no, I am- I'm trying to be positive

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'm trying to be positive.  I'm trying to say I hope that doesn't happen.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Okey Well- well-, you know what?  I was hoping that you would help

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm very sorry.  I understand you're upset.  You just got off a long flight.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You don't understand. You don't understand, actually.  You don't understand because it was my luggage that was lost.  Okay.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: We really -- we want to work with you. We really -- we want to help.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I understand that.  I would know if it was mine. Um-

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah.  If it was yours, but it's not. It's mine.  Okay. So just--

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: But it's not.  It's yours.  I understand.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I know.  We want to work with you.  We will give you the fifty dollars but I'm--

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No, it's not going to be -- but it's not going to be fifty, it's going to be a hundred and fifty.  You're going to write three, you understand, three of- of the forms.  You're going to write three of them out and then give it to me.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah, we don't do that.  I can go ahead and send you--

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You- you- you- you're misunderstanding me.  You're going to do that.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: No, No, I'm really looking forward to it.  You know how long -- I have been talking about this forever, right? right?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Uh huh.  Yes, seriously, for years.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Finally.  I'm so excited.  We're gonna -- well, I'll be here.  We're still gonna be able to see each other.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I know.  I know.  I'm- I'm definitely -- I realize [LAUGHTER].

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: We're gonna hang out, right?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What are you, wait, what are you doing?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Um- I'm gonna be studying at U.S.C., too.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Perfect!  Oh, my God.  Are you staying, are you going to live on campus?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Not on campus, but um- I probably won't live too far.  Maybe, I don't know, I might go to Silver Lake or something.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Welcome to our company, My name is Jon Dahl Green. I'm in charge of the export department. Let me give you my business card.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I'll give you mine too.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Umm how was your flight?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Not bad, but I'm a little tired.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Here's your schedule. After this meeting, we will visit the factory and have another meeting with the production manager and our director.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Could you arrange a meeting with your boss?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Of course. I've arranged it at ten o'clock tomorrow morning.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well, shall we get down to business.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Sure, did you receive the sample we sent last week?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yes, we finished the evaluation of it. If the price is acceptable we would like to order now.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm very glad to hear that.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: What's your best price for that item?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: The unit price is twelve fifty dollars.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: I think the price is a little high, can't you reduce it?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I'm afraid we can't. Twelve fifty is our rock bottom price. If you purchase more than ten thousand units we can reduce it to twelve dollars.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Well, I'll accept the price and place an initial order of ten thousand units.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Very good. It's been a pleasure to do business with you, Mr. Smith.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: The pleasure is ours. Can you deliver the goods by March thirty first?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Of course.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah.  I suppose I have been. But it's going from me.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You've got to tell me.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: I don't even know how to start.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: It wouldn't work like this.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: It's just all mixed up with so many other things, you know?  You know overseas I was in command of a company?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Yeah, sure.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Well I lost them.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: How many?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Pretty much all.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Aw, geez.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Hi, um, excuse me, I believe that the airline lost my baggage.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Um, okay, it didn't--didn't come out on the carrousel--

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: No, it didn't. um It didn't come out and I don't see it anywhere around here, so what can you do about that?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Okay.  Um, well, unfortunately yeah there was a some- some problems with the--

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Some problems?  What is that supposed to mean?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Uh, well some-some of the bags were--were lost on the way over here. uh-

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How do you lose a suitcase?  A huge suitcase?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: You know, I mean, there's a lot of things that go on under the plane and sometimes, you know, that kind of things happen.

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Uh, But, we are willing to reimburse you for the bag and and for the contents--

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: How much?

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah, that is--how long you guys been together now?

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Two and a half years. [LAUGHTER]

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Okay.  All right.  So-[LAUGHTER]-quite a while.  I mean--That's-  That's good.  I'm so happy for you. [LAUGHTER]

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Thank you. Thank you so much.

utterances.speaker: A
utterances.text: Yeah, I'd love to be in that same situation some day, but, wow- so-

utterances.speaker: B
utterances.text: Oh, you will--You'll find just the right girl.  And she'll be perfect for you and everything will be great.
